attributes.action: Make law all party members are allowed to vote in a party leadership election .
attributes.background: This law will make leadership races more democratic and stamp out gerrymandering.

attributes.action: Create a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather
attributes.background: We all know that the public holidays in the UK are unevenly distributed and usually coincide with periods of very poor weather. We can't blame the government for that, however, we do have the power to change it!
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of having two 'bank' holidays in May, we should designate an alternative one day 'Met Office' day every year. This would not be a day that the Met Office gets to chill out, but a day that is designated at short notice when the 'experts' at the Met Office are confident that we will all be able to light the BBQ and actually make the most of time with family and friends. 

In summary, exchange one of the May Bank Holidays for a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather.

attributes.action: Guarantee the estimated £3.8 million of HLS funding for the New Forest.
attributes.background:
There will be a £3.8 million gap in funding for the New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme for 2019 and 2020 once the UK officially leaves the EU.

The scheme is vital to protecting the New Forest's unique environment. That's why we're calling on the government to continue funding the scheme.
attributes.additional_details:
The New Forest Higher Level Stewardship Scheme is a formal partnership between the Verderers, the Forestry Commission and the New Forest National Park Authority.

It has:
Restored miles of internationally-important habitats for wildlife
Supported the historic practice of commoning, which maintains the unique Forest landscape
Worked to identify & protect historic sites

New Forest Commoners: http://www.nfcda.com/news--meetings.html
Official page: http://www.hlsnewforest.org.uk/hls/site/index.php

attributes.action: Any decision which may lead to significant changes must be agreed by parliament.
attributes.background: Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. This petition is so that any major changes to the UK must be debated in the Commons & agreed to by parliamentary vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently we have heard a lot of differing opinions on the actioning of article 50 of the EU charter. 
As we know there was a referendum with a narrow margin in favour of leaving the EU. However given the imperfection information provided by both campaign the final decision should be debated by the Commons and voted on by this elected parliament to ensure the best outcome for all. Any major decisions regarding the future of the United Kingdom made in the UK should be debated and agreed upon by parliament who hold sovereignty. Any executive power held by the Prime Minister derived from the crown should be held to a minimum.

attributes.action: Make the offence of misconduct in a public office statutory, to include MP's.
attributes.background: It is alleged that some MP's knowingly lied about the facts to the public during the recent EU referendum thereby causing those members of the public to vote in a way they would not have done if in possession of the true facts. The current law of misconduct in a public office is unclear.
attributes.additional_details: The current law on misconduct in public office is not statutory,  and there is a limited definition of who holds public office which does not include MP's. The law needs to be placed on statute and MP's should be included in the definition of holders of public office and liable to commit the offence except where parliamentary privilege exists. This would mean that MP's could be prosecuted where they abuse the public's trust in the office holder by, for example, lying in a referendum debate.

attributes.action: Change the law on combustion engine assisted push bicycles
attributes.background: In the UK it is the law to register, MOT, tax and insure a push bike with a combustion engine on. There are many kits available to fit to your push bike that range up to 80cc. In many countries they are exempt from registration and insurance with success and I think that the same should apply here.
attributes.additional_details: In countries such as Australia it is almost encouraged to use these vehicles as an alternative to cars. They are easy to use, build and repair, are very economical and cause less pollution than a single person travelling in a car. I believe that similar laws should be in place here to allow oppertunities for people who may not be able to afford or run a car or who wish to choose alternative transport. They will help to reduce city traffic and emissions and help to keep roads clearer.

attributes.action: Pull our troops out of any provocative acts towards Russia.
attributes.background: To anyone with a little knowledge it is easy to see that the US and UK governmentso are trying to provoke Russia with extremely dangerous and hostile acts, including the strategic placement of missile systems.  We the people DO NOT want a war with Russia.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has sent troops to the Russian border.

attributes.action: Companies should have a tax contribution symbol indicating how much tax they pay
attributes.background: Companies should have a simple to understand visual indicator such as an emoji to tell consumers how much tax they contribute as compared to revenue and how much their ceo is paid in comparison to the income of workers and company revenue/growth.

attributes.action: Reduce basic VAT rate to 15%, with further reduction after we have left the EU
attributes.background:
The 'Leave' camp pointed out that the EU sets minimums for VAT rates. The EU basic rate is a minimum of 15% but the UK is currently higher than this, at 20%.

We can't lower it below 15% until we leave the EU, but we *can* lower it to 15%, and then lower it more after we leave the EU
attributes.additional_details:
When the Leave campaign said that while in the EU, we would be unable to control our VAT rates. This is accurate, the EU sets minimums for different categories.

At the moment, we are still in the EU, so have to abide by those rules. 

However, the basic rate of VAT in the UK is currently 20%. This is 5% more than the EU's minimum basic rate of 15% - meaning that we have control over that 5%. Let's get rid of that 5% that we *do* have control of, and once we have left the EU, reduce it further!

attributes.action: Make MPs promise to protect certain EU legislation, including workers' rights.
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of the EU. As has been pointed out numerous times it is bureaucratic and its organisation has many flaws. That said I voted to remain because being a member has made the UK a better, fairer country. I fear this being undone and the country going backwards, not forwards.
attributes.additional_details:
17,410,742 people voted to leave the EU in the referendum, but 16,141,241 voted to stay. If slightly over 630,000 had voted differently the remain campaign would have won the vote. Though the wishes of the majority must be accepted, it would be intolerable to ignore the wishes of the remain voters.

If the UK wishes to be an outward looking nation then a public statement must be made by MPs from all parties that EU legislation regarding workers' rights and the environment will be protected.

attributes.action: stop councils using loose chippings as surface repair
attributes.background: Councils need to stop wasting money on surface chipping and do repairs to the road as it damage's vehicles

attributes.action: Publish a database registering all the Brexit questions and current answers.
attributes.background: As we move closer to Brexit we must all be positive and engage with Government on all of the questions arising from exit some will be simple others more complex but the both the Nation and the EU must know the current UK position.
attributes.additional_details:
Today the Scottish First Minister demanded action on the position of EU national living in the UK.
Friday 3 questions were raised in the Scottish Parliament. The position on the EU arrest warrant, EU Student studying in the UK and  one other.
But as we progress there will be many questions which will make there way to a Bill that goes before parliament. All we ask is to be kept in the picture

attributes.action: Make businesses refund as fast as they debt you
attributes.background: It's very annoying that companies can debt you immediately for purchases but are unable to refund you up to 5 working days. This needs to be changed to immediate.

attributes.action: No free bus passes,tv licences for people holding over 100k in account.
attributes.background: Not fair lot of millionaires in uk can afford it and they still get all these benefits.

attributes.action: To force councils to invest revenue from parking fines into parking facilities
attributes.background: It is a well known fact that parking fines generate huge profits for local councils, c.£600million+, but there is no action or interest in reducing the number of parking fines issued to motorists, as this is viewed as a profit generator for all local councils alike
attributes.additional_details:
Councils should be forced to invest the large majority of these funds into parking solutions/facilities i.e. underground car parks in densely populated cities and towns, or road improvements where parking improvements are not feasible.

Any improvements should reflect the requirement for resident, business and visitor parking.

attributes.action: For MPs to stop referring to each other as "honourable".
attributes.background: The EU referendum has shown that several MPs are quite happy to knowingly mislead the general public with untruths so the House Of Commons address of "my honourable friend" or "honourable lady/gentleman" is wholly inappropriate. Just referring to each other as "the MP for" would be correct.

attributes.action: Start working on a drive through tunnel for the Isle of Wight to help the locals
attributes.background: A fixed link drive through tunnel will help the locals, businesses, tourism and the economy of the Island and stop the ferry companies over pricing  the poor and slow service plus it will create employment and boost the Island as a great holiday destination for many many years to come.

attributes.action: Replace London with Edinburgh as UK capital
attributes.background: To foster a sense of UK-wide cohesion and inclusiveness, among Scottish people in particular. I believe that replacing London with Edinburgh as the UK's administrative capital would go some way in achieving this.
attributes.additional_details: To counter a sense of grievance, felt by many in Scotland over England’s dominance in the Union, particularly after the EU referendum. The capitals of the USA, Canada, Australia, Brazil and South Africa, are not simply their largest cities. Relocating the capital to Edinburgh will move the political centre of gravity to Northern Britain, where it is sorely needed. Anything that reduces the dominance of London over the UK without diminishing it’s global influence worldwide has to be welcomed.

attributes.action: UK practical driving test time to be reduced.
attributes.background: 40 minutes for a driving test is a long time to sit in a car with an examiner looking at you throughout the test. Many people fail their test not because their bad drivers but because their nervous and sweaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Sitting in an exam is hard as it is, but sitting one in a car with an examiner next to guy watching at everything you do is another thing. I think the driving test time should be reduced to at least 20-30 minutes. 

Many people fail their test because their nervous and don't know what the examiner is writing, it puts the learner under a lot of stress and end up failing their tests. £62 is a lot of money to spend every time you fail and have to rebook a test. Reducing the time will be good.

attributes.action: Stop bonfires, during the hours of daylight, in residential areas.
attributes.background: I live in an area with large gardens but neighbours frequently have bonfires during daylight hours. Smoke never blows into their garden! Gardens should be enjoyed and relaxing but this is impossible with smoke making you choke. If they waited until after dark, then no-one would be affected by it.

attributes.action: General elections after the UK referendum and after presentation of BREXIT plan
attributes.background: The referendum resultet in a small minority of just over 50% of voters to leave the EU. The political leadership is broken down, negativ economical effects have emerged already. The UK situation is historically unique and has long term effects for future generations. General elections are necessary.
attributes.additional_details: The economic, political and social future of the UK is uncertain for years. The referendum was not a vote for a Brexiteer government.  Brexiteers need to come up with a short, medium and long term plan and well thought through vision, present this to parliament and the population. The same applies for other parties. Immediately afterwards, the populations needs to have the right to choose which party they trust most with this challenging tasks ahead through their vote in general elections .

attributes.action: Organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate immigrants living & working in the UK
attributes.background: Immigrants living & working in the UK make a huge and positive contribution to our society. Many feel unsettled and anxious following the Referendum vote. We want them to know that they remain welcome in the UK and HM Govt should organise a concert at Wembley to celebrate their contribution.

attributes.action: Give landlords more power to self evict bad tenants who break their contracts
attributes.background: My husband and I are landlords of one property and have had some terrible tenants who either feel it's ok to not pay rent or flout other parts of the contract. We have just had our rental completely trashed and landlord insurance covers a tiny fraction. We are working class people who work hard.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/Bernard.Bernie.Mac/posts/10154331015367160

attributes.action: Vote registration system to validate UK citizenship prior to issuing ballot card
attributes.background: Many people unelligable to vote because they are not UK citizens are illegally registering to vote in UK ballots because there are insufficient background checks on nationality. In particular this was highlighted in the EU referendum, where non-UK citizens were voting to remain.
attributes.additional_details:
Background checks on citizenship must be applied prior to registration acceptance to prevent electoral fraud. 

Where people do commit fraud in elections there needs to be a mechanism for criminal prosecution, rigorously followed through by the police and courts.

attributes.action: Ask public about immigration before negotiating new EU deals
attributes.background: On June 23rd the UK voted to leave the EU. A number of public figures have suggested which factors swayed voters, but the question asked makes it impossible to know public opinion on specific issues. We believe the government cannot claim a mandate to negotiate a new deal without polling.
attributes.additional_details: Some have claimed that immigration was a key factor in the result, but it is impossible to say for certain that a majority of those who voted leave did so to prevent free movement of people. The government should take steps to more effectively gauge public opinion on the nature of Britain’s exit from the EU, so that it can act on facts, not speculation. The issues of environmental legislation, the EU arrest warrant, and the court of human rights should also be included in the poll.

attributes.action: Raise the salary for childcare workers in the early years sector
attributes.background: Childcare workers in the early years have one of the most important jobs in the sector as a whole. They are responsible for the early education, health and wellbeing of children under 5. A rewarding job is there ever was one however this is not reflected in their salaries.
attributes.additional_details: The average full time childcare worker in the early years sector makes less than £1050 per month after deductions. This simply is not reflective of the love, hard work, sacrifice and determination to give the future the best possible start in life. As a childcare worker there is no greater joy than helping a child succeed at being a child and being happy, healthy and confident. But job satisfaction can only take you so far when a roof over your head is needed.

attributes.action: Bring back half day closing on a Wednesday and close full day Sunday
attributes.background: We should bring back half day and Sunday closing to help the economy and give more people family time as more places are open on the Internet

attributes.action: Allow the alternative vote in the next General Election
attributes.background: With the current state of the country and the government in turmoil a General Election looks likely. We demand it incorporates the alternative vote system in order to encourage a fairer outcome for all political parties and allow voters to adequately portray their political views.

attributes.action: Change legislation and bring back the 500cc 2 stroke motorcycle engine.
attributes.background: Now that we are coming out of the EU, its about time the large 2 stroke motorcycle engine is brought back to the uk. It makes riding a motorcycle much more fun that a heavy old 4 stroke.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.gizmag.com/honda-two-stroke-with-fuel-injection-patent-filing/38529/
http://www.dirtrider.com/honda-building-efi-controlled-direct-injected-two-stroke

attributes.action: Stop Expatriates Having A Vote On British Issues Such As Elections & Referendums
attributes.background:
Just over 4.5 million Britons live abroad with approximately 1.3 million of them in Europe. Allowing them to vote on British issues severely alters the results of elections and referendums.
If Britain isn't good enough for them to live or pay Tax in then why should they have a say in how it is run?
attributes.additional_details:
We saw during the EU referendum over a million Spanish expats (selfishly) tried to vote 'stay' in Europe purely because they wanted to keep their NHS benefits abroad! Not for the good of the country.

Sign if you believe British Expats who do not live or pay Tax in the Britain should NOT be able to vote in Britain!

attributes.action: Seize this opportunity to reform the EU by offering an alternative system.
attributes.background: Across Europe much dissatisfaction is being heard, with membership referenda being called for in many other countries. We have the world's best diplomats. This is an opportunity for us to seize the initiative in constructing a Europe Mk II that  recognises sovereignty but encourages free trade.

attributes.action:
Reopen negotiations with EU to agree better terms for UK.
Hold 2nd referendum.
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum was based upon the last negotiations, which failed to satisfy the majority of voters.
Nevertheless, so momentous is the decision, the U.K. population deserve the opportunity to reconsider a further, more favourable, revision of our terms of membership in a 2nd referendum.

attributes.action: Allow Norwich South to have a referendum to become independent from the UK
attributes.background: Norwich South voted to remain in the EU, the only remain constitiency in Norfolk. We shouldn't have to be taken out of the EU against our own will. If we are to remain in the UK then the Golden Triangle shall revolt!
attributes.additional_details: Norwich South was the only place in Norfolk to vote to remain in the EU, one of five in East Anglia.

attributes.action: As law all convicted racists must integrate with whom they discriminate against
attributes.background: Instead of a slap on the wrist show them the people they are discriminating against, in a community service like format make them for example: go to mosque or church and go to community gatherings for an alotted ammount of hours

attributes.action: Take actions to eliminate bullying to teenage boys that enjoy Performing Arts.
attributes.background:
I'm a young boy and I really like dance - so much, that I would like to do it as a career. But unfortunately this isn't an easy thing to do - lots of homophobic bullying is involved. This shouldn't be tolerated. Boys and girls are equal - and so should be treated as so.
FACE THE FACTS, BOYS DANCE!

attributes.action: Require a new referendum on EU with minimum 5% majority to be valid.
attributes.background: With new facts that have come to light, so many people voting based in mis-information and lack of detail, and the divided country we now live in, we want a new referendum on leaving the EU with a clear 5% majority. It's too an important decision to accept a 2% lead and a divided country.

attributes.action: Ban, for at least one year, petitions on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Rerunning debates in Parliament that have been discussed ad nauseum takes up the valuable time of MPs. The country needs to settle after a protracted build up to the recent EU referendum. Forcing further debate in Parliament is negative.

attributes.action: Give Scotland a referendum with option for independence ONLY if UK leaves EU
attributes.background: Many people in Scotland only want independence because the UK is leaving the EU and should be given this explicit option. If results of this referendum show that leaving the EU will lead to breakup of the UK, there should be another UK referendum on leaving EU as leave voters did not know this.
attributes.additional_details: Following the EU leave vote, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon is seeking an independence referendum on grounds that Scottish people do not want to leave EU. However leave voters did not know that Scottish independence was a consequence of their vote. The fairest way to address this is to urgently hold a Scottish referendum which would be binding only if UK continues to leave EU. Then UK should be given second referendum in full knowledge of the consequences of leaving EU.

attributes.action: Give free British citizenship to EU immigrants working in the UK over 5 years.
attributes.background: The U.K. is demonstrating a hostile feeling towards all immigrants.And now we are a population that feel openly ostracised,voiceless,discriminated against and unwelcome. We need clear evidence that we are wanted and welcome in this country and proof that we are an integral part of the U.K.'s future.
attributes.additional_details: The leaders of this country have a lot to answer to Immigrants for now.What's in it for us now that we are out of the EU and living in the UK? Besides xenophobia and ostracisation? What certainties are there for immigrants' future as members of this society and how are we clearly a part of the strategy for a United Kingdom that no longer abides by the laws and regulations of the EU. Giving us British citizenship will be the only true way immigrants will feel included and part of the U.K. again.
attributes.creator_name: Vasco Sérgio Rodrigues Gaspar de Almeida Santos

attributes.action: Legalise the use of hemp oil for medical purpose within the UK.
attributes.background: Scientific facts prove the benifit of this oil..
attributes.additional_details: Rick Simpson  cancer uk. Many other scientific studies.

attributes.action: False statements and misrepresentation by politicians to be electoral fraud
attributes.background:
It is currently only counts as electoral fraud if a party makes a false statement about the character of a candidate.
Nobody is held to account for misrepresenting policies and outcomes in elections which is much more dangerous, leading people to vote based on false information.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of this include:
The Vote Leave campaign claiming to spend £350 million a week on the NHS which was quickly denied the morning after the referendum.
Liberal Democrats wanting to rid students of tuition fees, but in a coalition government put fees up to £9000 a year.

attributes.action: A UK Bill of Rights should be introduced as the country leaves the EU.
attributes.background: With the outcome of the UK Referendum now known, many people are concerned about losing the protection of ECHR. A Bill of Rights to protect and enhance our freedoms is a clear statement of our country's commitment to these principles. It should be introduced to coincide with our exit from the Union.

attributes.action: Have a referendum on whether the citizens of UK want the breakup of the UK.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the prospect that Northern Ireland and Scotland will leave the United Kingdom, and 48 % of people did not want the UK to leave the EU, this historic breakup of the UK should be the subject of a referendum.

attributes.action: EU referendum results CAN NOT be OVERTURNED or PETITIONED against within 4 years
attributes.background: If a referendum result has been won there should not be another referendum called to dispute the original within 4 years.

attributes.action: Re-establish faith in the UK by making all EU regulations UK law before leaving.
attributes.background: The UK must demonstrate to the world that it is a beacon of international collaboration, co-operation and responsibility. We should start by enshrining into UK law all the regulations and agreements that would expire when we leave the EU, so that it takes a change of law to break an agreement.
attributes.additional_details: We need to show that we don't discard our international agreements and responsibilities lightly, while also boosting confidence that things remain as they are now unless Parliament decides otherwise. We should adopt into law a presumption that each of our international commitments will remain in effect unless a new law is passed to revoke it. We don't want to throw out the good rules with the bad, and we should properly debate each rule we want to get rid of, and know which rules will go, when.

attributes.action: Calculate results based on number of registered voters even those who abstain.
attributes.background: The official result of the EU referendum was that 52% voted leave, whereas when the total number of registered voters was taken into account the result was only 37%. Likewise, in the last General Election in at least one area the number of abstainers was greater than the winning candidate's margin.
attributes.additional_details: There is a large portion of the country who choose not to vote as they believe it will make no difference. We the undersigned believe it's time to change the system so that result percentages are calculated using the number of registered voters and not only those who voted. We believe that this will give a more accurate picture of what the citizens of this country want.

attributes.action: Extend existing points immigration rules to non-Common Travel Area nationals
attributes.background: We petition parliament to extend the points based immigration system that applies to non-EU nationals to the citizens of countries outside the Common Travel Area, and make necessary adjustments to the points requirements to ensure an adequate supply of labour to the various sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Common travel area: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/common-travel-area-cta/common-travel-area-cta

Immigration rules that apply to non-EU citizens: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/immigration-rules/immigration-rules-index

attributes.action: Form an Interim Brexit Government to negotiate the UK's extraction from the EU.
attributes.background:
Dissolve the current Government.
Form an Interim Brexit Government (IBG) with no Remain members in it.
No General Election will be held until the final withdrawal from the EU. 
This is to provide stability until extraction from the EU.
IBG must be made up of members of all parties.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM of the IBG must be chosen by the MP's of Westminster only to prevent factionalism from devolved Governments.
Oversight committees to consist equally of Remain and Brexit members and an independent chairman, to provide the checks and balances required in the EU extraction talks.
Inform Scottish and Northern Irish that if, after the final EU extraction process is complete and they still want to hold a referendum then they can hold them then.

attributes.action: Make it law that a 2nd referendum cant be called for 20 years after the 1st.
attributes.background: To protect the democratic purpose of a refurendum a 2nd should not be held just because people disagree with the outcome. Having the law would mean people are fully aware of the consequences of voting in the first place. Its unfair for people to cast a vote then have to worry it could be overturned
attributes.additional_details: 2014 scottish independance from the UK referendum & 2016 UK membership of the EU referendum. These are two examples where calls for a 2nd referendum should be cancelled out by law, the decision has been made and should be respected.

attributes.action: Allow the youth (14-17) to vote in larger elections/referendums
attributes.background:
Big decisions affects them as well, and their future should be the prime concern at the heart of future referendums. 
At the end of the day it is there futures on the line and it would be selfish to deny them a vote.
not letting them vote would be scandalous and would cause outrage among them.
attributes.additional_details:
This is backed up by the fact that YouGov's statistics said 18-24 year olds mostly voted to remain. 
Young people are also told to voice their opinion and this would help them alot, whilst also introducing them to politics and wanting to contribute to society.
